1.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Recite <break time='200ms'/> and <break time='200ms'/> enjoy. <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

2.text: Look at that hat on the cat who sat on the mat I want that hat.
2.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Look <break time='200ms'/> at <break time='200ms'/> that <break time='200ms'/> hat <break time='200ms'/> on <break time='200ms'/> the <break time='200ms'/> cat <break time='200ms'/> who <break time='200ms'/> sat <break time='200ms'/> on <break time='200ms'/> the <break time='200ms'/> mat <break time='200ms'/> I <break time='200ms'/> want <break time='200ms'/> that <break time='200ms'/> hat. <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

3.text: Shall I play outside today? The sky is gray I will go another day!
3.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Shall <break time='200ms'/> I <break time='200ms'/> play <break time='200ms'/> outside <break time='200ms'/> today? <break time='200ms'/> The <break time='200ms'/> sky <break time='200ms'/> is <break time='200ms'/> gray <break time='200ms'/> I <break time='200ms'/> will <break time='200ms'/> go <break time='200ms'/> another <break time='200ms'/> day! <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

4.text: Get the students to read the poem aloud. Then do the following game.
4.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Get <break time='200ms'/> the <break time='200ms'/> students <break time='200ms'/> to <break time='200ms'/> read <break time='200ms'/> the <break time='200ms'/> poem <break time='200ms'/> aloud. <break time='200ms'/> Then <break time='200ms'/> do <break time='200ms'/> the <break time='200ms'/> following <break time='200ms'/> game. <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

5.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Leaf <break time='200ms'/> pasting <break time='200ms'/> game:- <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

6.text: Make 40 leaves cut out of Bristol board. Write 20 short and 20 long vowel words on them. Use the vowel sound focused in the poem. Put them in a box. Take the children out of the class. Divide them into two groups. Take two Bristol boards and paste one word with the short vowel given in the poem on one board and a word with the long vowel in the poem on the other. Ask one member of each group to come and select a word, read it and paste it on the correct board with the similar sounding word. Once they all have finished pasting, the teacher can check. For each correct word, the teacher can paste a green dot. The team that gets the highest number of green dots will win.
